name: cargo run

name: mv

name: less
description: View files one page at a time

name: head
description: Display the first few lines of a file

name: tail
description: Display the last few lines of a file

name: grep
description: Search for a pattern in files

name: sudo
description: Execute a command as the superuser

name: git status
description: Check the status of the repository

name: git pull
description: Fetch and merge changes from a remote repository

name: git push
description: Push changes to a remote repository

name: pip install -r requirements.txt
description: Install dependencies from a requirements file

name: docker pull
description: Pull an image from a registry

name: docker push
description: Push an image to a registry

name: INSERT
usage: INSERT INTO table (column1, column2) VALUES (value1, value2)

name: UPDATE
usage: UPDATE table SET column1 = value1 WHERE condition

name: CREATE TABLE
usage: CREATE TABLE table (column1 datatype, column2 datatype)

name: ALTER TABLE
usage: ALTER TABLE table ADD column datatype

name: curl
description: Transfer data from or to a server

name: uptime
description: Show how long the system has been running

name: netstat
description: Display network connections, routing tables, interface statistics, masquerade connections, and multicast memberships

description: Trace the route to a host

description: Stream editor for filtering and transforming text

name: wc
description: Word, line, character, and byte count

description: Show changes required by the current configuration

description: Apply a configuration to a resource by filename or stdin

description: Copy files to and from S3

description: Launch one or more EC2 instances

name: az vm create
usage: az vm create --resource-group myResourceGroup --name myVM --image UbuntuLTS --admin-username azureuser --generate-ssh-keys

name: az storage blob upload
description: Upload a blob to a storage container
usage: az storage blob upload --container-name mycontainer --file myfile.txt --name myfile.txt

description: Synchronize files and directories between two locations

description: Reapply commits on top of another branch

usage: SELECT * FROM table1 JOIN table2 ON table1.id = table2.id
